name: Python
description: A high-level, interpreted programming language used for a wide range of purposes, including web development, scientific computing, data analysis, artificial intelligence, and more. Python is known for its simplicity, readability, and ease of use.

name: Variable
description: A named storage location in a program that holds a value or reference. Variables are used to store and manipulate data in a program, and can be assigned, modified, and accessed as needed.

name: Function
description: A reusable block of code that performs a specific task or operation. Functions are used to break down complex problems into smaller, more manageable components, and can be called and used from other parts of a program.

name: Module
description: A file containing Python code that can be imported and used in other Python programs. Modules provide a way to organize and reuse code, and can be used to encapsulate related functions, classes, and data structures.

name: List
description: A collection of ordered, mutable elements enclosed in square brackets, separated by commas. Lists are used to store and manipulate data in a program, and can be accessed and modified using indexing and slicing operations.

name: Dictionary
description: A collection of key-value pairs enclosed in curly braces, separated by commas. Dictionaries are used to store and manipulate data in a program, and can be accessed and modified using keys and values.

name: Class
description: A blueprint or template for creating objects in a program. Classes encapsulate data and behavior into reusable objects, and can be used to define complex data structures, algorithms, and systems.

name: Exception
description: An error or unexpected event that occurs during the execution of a program. Exceptions are used to handle errors and prevent programs from crashing or terminating unexpectedly, and can be caught and handled using try-except blocks.

name: Decorator
description: A function or class that modifies the behavior of another function or class without changing its source code. Decorators are used to add functionality to existing code, and can be used to implement cross-cutting concerns such as logging, caching, and authentication.

name: Lambda
description: A small, anonymous function that can be defined and used inline in a program. Lambdas are used to write short, one-time-use functions that can be passed as arguments to other functions or used in list comprehensions.

name: Python
description: An interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language that is widely used for web development, scientific computing, data analysis, artificial intelligence, and other applications.

name: Variable
description: A named memory location used to store a value or data. Variables in Python can be assigned different types of data, including numbers, strings, lists, and other objects.

name: Function
description: A block of code that performs a specific task or set of tasks. Functions in Python are used to organize code, avoid repetition, and modularize programs.

name: List
description: A collection of ordered and mutable elements, represented by square brackets []. Lists in Python can contain any type of data, including other lists and objects.

name: Dictionary
description: A collection of unordered and mutable key-value pairs, represented by curly braces {}. Dictionaries in Python are used to map keys to values, and can contain any type of data.

name: Class
description: A blueprint for creating objects that defines a set of attributes and methods. Classes in Python are used to model real-world entities and implement object-oriented programming.

name: Module
description: A file containing Python code that can be imported and used in other programs. Modules in Python are used to organize code, improve code reuse, and provide additional functionality.

name: Package
description: A collection of related modules and sub-packages that can be used together to implement a specific functionality or feature. Packages in Python are used to organize code and distribute reusable code libraries.

name: Conditional statement
description: A statement that is executed based on a condition or set of conditions. Conditional statements in Python include if-else statements, which are used to control the flow of execution based on logical expressions.

name: Loop
description: A control flow statement that allows code to be executed repeatedly based on a condition or set of conditions. Loops in Python include for loops and while loops, which are used to iterate over a sequence of elements or perform a set of tasks until a condition is met.
